channel.title: On Dart
channel.description: On Dart Blog by Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: Test Model
item.description: Edit a todo. Test the model.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: Complete All Todos
item.description: Complete all to do tasks.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: Load and Save Data
item.description: Tasks are loaded from a local storage and saved to the local storage as a JSON document, with a help of dartling.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: Clear Completed Tasks
item.description: Completed tasks may be cleared (removed). A single task, completed or not, may be also removed.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: Tasks Left Todo
item.description: There is a footer with a count of tasks left to do.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: Todo Application
item.description: In the todo_mvc_s01 spiral, there is a new lib/app folder with two dart files, one for the todo application and the other for a todo widget.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: Generated Model
item.description: A graphical model is transformed automatically into JSON and the code for the complete web application is generated by dartling. The model, initialized with some entities, becomes alive in the web application.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: dartling Todos
item.description: Recently, Dart has been used by Mathieu Lorber to develop the todomvc application without a model framework. I have adapted the todomvc application to dartling. The dartling_todos application has the standard TodoMVC presentation but with one difference – a user may undo (and redo) actions.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: mb spirals updated to M1 of Dart
item.description: The code of spirals in the [mb] (https://github.com/dzenanr/mb) project has been updated to M1 of Dart.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: A year of fun and hard work on learning Dart
item.description: For me, it was a fun year of learning Dart, more fun when developing and less fun when writing about it. My software projects help me teach better. My teaching efforts help me explore new research avenues. My research activities help me develop better. And those are spirals as well, n'est-ce pas?
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral12 To Spiral13
item.description:
In Spiral 12, a model may be saved in a local storage under a model name and later opened by using the model name. A type of a data attribute may be changed from default String to another type. Based on the current item obtained by the Get 1 button (where 1 is determined by the name in the item input field), the next item may be selected by the Get +1 (Next) button.
In Spiral 13, there are only minor changes. In the Menu Bar, the File menu is renamed to Model. A model may be opened, saved and closed. In the Tool Bar, the Get 1 (item) button is renamed, as it used to be, to Get. The sequence of buttons is rearranged, so that buttons with -1 are now after buttons with +1.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral11 To Spiral12
item.description:
In Spiral 11, a model may be transformed to JSON and back from JSON to a model. JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. JSON is easy for humans to understand and for software to parse it. It is based on two data structures: a collection of name/value pairs {} and an ordered list of values [].
In Spiral 12, a model may be saved in a local storage under a model name and later opened by using the model name. A type of a data attribute may be changed from default String to another type. Based on the current item obtained by the Get 1 button (where 1 is determined by the name in the item input field), the next item may be selected by the Get +1 (Next) button.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral10 To Spiral11
item.description:
In Spiral 10, a relationship created between two concepts, may be changed to inheritance or is-a relationship, first by selecting the relationship line, second by getting information about the relationship in the tool bar, third by choosing the inheritance category in the pop-up list. Similarly, the obtained relationship may be categorized as reflexive or twin. A reflexive relationship will connect the parent concept to itself. Two relationships between the same two concepts will split apart when becoming twins.
In Spiral 11, a model may be transformed to JSON and back from JSON to a model. JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. JSON is easy for humans to understand and for software to parse it. It is based on two data structures: a collection of name/value pairs {} and an ordered list of values [].
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral09 To Spiral10
item.description:
In Spiral 09, line min..max cardinalities may be changed by getting the selected line with a click on the Get button in the tool bar, making changes and setting them with a click on the Set button. Line direction names may be added. A line direction with 1..1 cardinalities may become a part of the identifier of the source concept.
In Spiral 10, a relationship created between two concepts, may be changed to inheritance or is-a relationship, first by selecting the relationship line, second by getting information about the relationship in the tool bar, third by choosing the inheritance category in the pop-up list. Similarly, the obtained relationship may be categorized as reflexive or twin. A reflexive relationship will connect the parent concept to itself. Two relationships between the same two concepts will split apart when becoming twins.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral08 To Spiral09
item.description: In Spiral 08, for the last selected box, its title may be changed and an item may be added. In Spiral 09, line min..max cardinalities may be changed by getting the selected line with a click on the Get button in the tool bar, making changes and setting them with a click on the Set button. Line direction names may be added. A line direction with 1..1 cardinalities may become a part of the identifier of the source concept.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral07 To Spiral08
item.description: In Spiral 07, a line may be selected and deleted. In Spiral 08, for the last selected box, its title may be changed and an item may be added.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral06 To Spiral07
item.description: In Spiral 06, a line tool in the tool bar, allows a line creation between the last two clicked boxes. In Spiral 07, a line may be selected and deleted. A menu bar has Edit, View and Create menus. The Edit menu has menu items for selecting all boxes and lines, and for deleting selected boxes and lines. The View menu has menu items for hiding and showing selected boxes and lines. The Create menu has menu items for generating boxes in a diagonal and as tiles.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral05 To Spiral06
item.description: In Spiral 05, there is a tool bar that provides a new way of creating, selecting and moving boxes. In Spiral 06, a menu bar provides four buttons to select all boxes, to delete selected boxes, to hide selected boxes and to show hidden boxes. A line tool in the tool bar, allows a line creation between the last two clicked boxes.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral04 To Spiral05
item.description: In Spiral 04, each box has a title with the sequential number and (x, y) coordinates, and the same four items. In Spiral 05, boxes have the same appearance, but there is a tool bar that provides a new way of creating, selecting and moving boxes.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral03 To Spiral04
item.description: In Spiral 03, a box may be created by clicking on an empty space in the board, selected and then moved. In Spiral 04, each box has a title and the same four items. A box title has an incremental number and its (x, y) coordinates within the board. A box is moved only if it is selected and if the mouse is pressed down.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral02 To Spiral03
item.description: In Spiral 02, three boxes may be moved within the board. In Spiral 03, a box may be created by clicking on an empty space in the board, selected and then moved.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral01 To Spiral02
item.description: In Spiral 01, two static boxes were displayed on the board. In Spiral 02, three boxes may be moved within the board.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: From Spiral00 To Spiral01
item.description: In Spiral 00, the code was generated by Dart Editor. The "Hello World!" text is displayed in a web page. In Spiral 01, the code from Spiral 00 is changed to display two rectangles (boxes).
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic

item.title: On Dart
item.description: On Dart Blog: To help you learn Dart in order to develop Web software.
item.author: Dzenan Ridjanovic
